tool.name: @BINARY@
tool.description: plots the relation of short vs long range contacts
tool.command:
#for $counter, $m in enumerate($matrix_h5_cooler_multiple): ln -s '$m' '${counter}_$m.element_identifier' && #end for #set $m = ' '.join([ '\'%s_%s\'' % ($counter, $matrix.element_identifier) for $counter, $matrix in enumerate($matrix_h5_cooler_multiple) ])
@BINARY@ --matrices $m
#if $distance: --distance $distance #end if
#if $chromosomes: #set $chromosome = ' '.join([ '\'%s\'' % $chrom for $chrom in str($chromosomes).split(' ') ]) --chromosomes $chromosome #end if
#if $colorList: #set $colorList_new = ' '.join([ '\'%s\'' % $color for $color in str($colorList).split(' ') ]) --colorList $colorList_new #end if
#if $dpi: --dpi $dpi #end if --plotFileName plot.$image_file_format --outFileName p_values.txt --outFileNameData ratios.txt --threads @THREADS@
&& mv plot.$image_file_format plot

param.label: Short range distance
param.help: Distance which should be considered as short range. Default 2MB.

param.label: Chromosomes to include
param.help: Chromosomes to include in the analysis. If not set, all chromosomes are included.

param.name: dpi
param.label: DPI for image
param.help: Change the default resolution of the plot.

tool.help:
Short vs long range contacts ============================
Computes the ratio of short vs. long range contacts on the given matrices and makes, if two or more matrices are present a differential test between the matrices.
For more information about HiCExplorer please consider our documentation on readthedocs.io_.
.. _readthedocs.io: http://hicexplorer.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html
